publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3657 Anne McLaughlin: Red Cross Accolade for Glasgow Teenagers—That the Parliament recognises the achievements of the members of the Global Glasgow Youth Project who have been awarded a British Red Cross Humanitarian Citizen Award for their groundbreaking work with vulnerable young people in a township in South Africa; congratulates the 14 teenagers involved in the project for raising more than £25,000 to deliver aid and peer education to young people from Khayelitsha township in Cape Town, and believes that these young people from Glasgow are great role models for anyone aspiring to make a positive difference to the lives of others. Supported by: Bob Doris*, Stuart McMillan*, Aileen Campbell*, Bill Wilson*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Alasdair Allan*, Sandra White*, Bill Kidd*, Robin Harper*
S3M-3657 Red Cross Accolade for Glasgow Teenagers (lodged on 10 March 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Kenneth Gibson*

S3M-3657 Anne McLaughlin: Red Cross Accolade for Glasgow Teenagers—That the Parliament recognises the achievements of the members of the Global Glasgow Youth Project who have been awarded a British Red Cross Humanitarian Citizen Award for their groundbreaking work with vulnerable young people in a township in South Africa; congratulates the 14 teenagers involved in the project for raising more than £25,000 to deliver aid and peer education to young people from Khayelitsha township in Cape Town, and believes that these young people from Glasgow are great role models for anyone aspiring to make a positive difference to the lives of others. Supported by: Bob Doris, Stuart McMillan, Aileen Campbell, Bill Wilson, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Alasdair Allan, Sandra White, Bill Kidd, Robin Harper, Jamie Hepburn, Kenneth Gibson, Michael Matheson*, Gil Paterson*, Christina McKelvie*
S3M-3657 Red Cross Accolade for Glasgow Teenagers (lodged on 10 March 2009) Christine Grahame*
S3M-3657 Red Cross Accolade for Glasgow Teenagers (lodged on 10 March 2009) Angela Constance*
